In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function `wrap_string` in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            println(line)
            line = "$word"
        else
            line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    println(line)
end
```
Here is an example:
```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
wrap_string(str)
```
This will print:
```plaintext
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt
ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
```
